conclusion: Understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves.
Shadow A is cast by the object on the left side of the image.
Shadow B is cast by the small object near the center.
Shadow C is cast by the large object on the left.
Shadow D is cast by the postcard holder on the right.
Shadows will shift in the direction opposite to the new light source when it moves.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will move towards the front right.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will move towards the front left.
Shadow A will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadow A will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
Shadow B will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadow B will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
Shadow C will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadow C will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
Shadow D will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadow D will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
The size of the shadows will generally decrease as the light source moves further away.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will move towards the front right.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will move towards the front left.
